data.title: Williams College on LinkedIn: Husband Sebastian Arcelus, wife Stephanie J. Block play married couple in…
data.meta_description: Actor Sebastian Arcelus '99 and his wife, Stephanie J. Block, are playing the baker and baker's wife in a Broadway revival of the Stephen Sondheim '50 classic…
data.text:
Cheers to Jordan Horton MA '23 on not one but two exciting professional developments. First, they started a new role as curator of the Visual Arts Center of New Jersey on Aug. 5: https://lnkd.in/dmtzdVBG Two weeks later, they were named a 2024 fellow of the Professional Alliance for Curators of Color: https://lnkd.in/dMaGWqe6 #WilliamsGradArt

Brava to Mika Brzezinski '89, whose Know Your Value initiative has partnered with Forbes to compile the fourth annual 50 Over 50 list, which showcases 200 women who have proven that success can be achieved at any age - among them, two #WomenOfWilliams: groundbreaking architect Diana Kellogg '84 and Guggenheim Museum and Foundation CEO Mariet Westermann '84. Read more: https://lnkd.in/g2ySuxEp

David Reiss '89 is headed to the Cornell Tech campus on NYC's Roosevelt Island, where he'll join the new Blassberg-Rice Center for Entrepreneurship Law as well as Cornell Tech’s Law, Technology and Entrepreneurship degree program. He previously taught at Brooklyn Law School for more than 20 years and founded its Community Development Clinic.

Paul Bierman '85, professor of environmental science at the University of Vermont and author of the new book, "When the Ice is Gone," hopes to inspire ingenuity, rather than gloom, when it comes to saving Greenland's ice sheet. Read how the inspiration for the book and the relationships that have guided his research all trace back to Williams: https://lnkd.in/gdzGxzY6

On the Vital Signs podcast, physicians and first-year entry mates Diane Shannon '85 MD MPH PCC and Mary Beth Miotto '85 MD MPH discuss why time management for women in medicine is less important than becoming an "energy owner." Learn more on Spotify https://lnkd.in/gRdU5zm4, Apple Podcast https://lnkd.in/gHRTAstm and other podcast outlets.

The Center for Houston's Future has named David Gow '85 as president and CEO, effective Sept. 3. The founder and chairman of Gow Media - who brings a master's in public policy from Harvard in addition to his Williams economics degree to his new role - will lead the Center’s Vision 2050 initiative, which plans to identify the city's key issues, gaps and opportunities. More: https://lnkd.in/gGUuM86Q

After a national search, MASS MoCA has appointed Evan Garza MA '24 as its newest curator, starting Sept. 3. Currently one of the six curatorial fellows through the museum’s Curatorial Exchange Initiative, Evan was the 2021–2022 Fulbright scholar at the Irish Museum of Modern Art in Dublin, and concurrently was a visiting research fellow in History of Art and Architecture at Trinity College Dublin. Details: https://lnkd.in/ecimZ4HY #WilliamsGradArt

Sara Suchman '86, executive director of the National Center for Montessori in the Public Sector, talks to USA Today about what sets the Montessori method apart from other learning approaches: https://lnkd.in/eEHbScQ4

Congratulations to research mathematician Haydee Lindo '08 of Harvey Mudd College on receiving the 2024 Henry L. Alder Award from the Mathematical Association of America. The award honors early-career faculty whose teaching has been extraordinarily successful and whose effectiveness in teaching undergraduate mathematics is shown to have influence beyond their own classrooms. Details: https://lnkd.in/gCP9vnyP

Steve Graham '82 began breaking in 1983 while working at Goldman Sachs, often performing in the suit and tie he’d worn to work that day. Known in the breaking community as Silverback, he is credited with fueling the renaissance of the sport, which debuts at the Olympics Aug. 9-10. Read more: https://lnkd.in/gZy2s36t
